build_chart.description: No build/height-weight chart is provided in this guide; underwriting is based purely on medical history and disease criteria.

medical_conditions.description: AHL Patriot Series classifies applicants into Preferred, Standard, Modified, or Decline based on specific medical conditions and time-frames since treatment or diagnosis.

conditions.guideline: If the applicant currently requires assistance with ADLs → Decline. If not currently requiring assistance → Standard.
Any history of medically treated or diagnosed AIDS/HIV → Decline.
Treated or counseled within the past 2 years → Modified. (No entry under Preferred/Standard/Decline for more remote history.)
Any medically diagnosed Alzheimer's → Decline.
Amputation caused by accident → Preferred. Amputation due to disease or due to diabetes → Decline.
Any medically diagnosed ALS → Decline.
Treated within 0–12 months → Modified. Treated 13–24 months ago → Standard. Treated ≥25 months ago → Preferred.
Treated within 0–12 months → Modified. Treated 13–24 months ago → Standard. Treated 24–36 months ago → Modified. (No Preferred slot.)
Treated within 0–12 months → Modified. Treated 13–24 months ago → Standard. Treated 24–36 months ago → Modified.
Any medically treated or diagnosed arrhythmia → Standard.
Any medically treated or diagnosed atrial fibrillation → Standard.
Any history of medically treated or diagnosed basal cell skin cancer → Standard.
Currently confined to a bed → Decline. Not currently confined (but history of confinement) → Standard.
Any history of bipolar disorder → Standard.
Any history of bone marrow transplant → Decline.
Recurrent cancer or currently active cancer → Decline. Medically diagnosed/treated 0–24 months ago (and cured) → Modified. Medically diagnosed/treated ≥24 months ago (and cured) → Standard.
Treated within 0–12 months → Modified. Treated 13–24 months ago → Standard. Treated ≥25 months ago → Preferred.
Within past 0–12 months → Modified. Within past 13–24 months → Standard. More than 25 months ago → Preferred.
Diagnosed/treated 0–24 months ago → Standard. Diagnosed/treated 24–36 months ago → Modified. Diagnosed/treated ≥37 months ago → Standard.
Diagnosed/treated 0–24 months ago → Modified. Diagnosed/treated ≥25 months ago → Standard.
Diagnosed/treated 0–24 months ago → Modified. Diagnosed/treated 24–36 months ago → Standard. Diagnosed/treated ≥37 months ago → Modified.
Diagnosed/treated within past 2 years → Preferred.
Surgery within past 0–12 months → Modified. Within 13–24 months → Standard. Within 24–36 months → Modified. ≥37 months ago → Preferred.
Any history of cirrhosis of the liver → Decline.
Any history of CHF → Decline.
Oxygen required within past 12 months → Decline. Oxygen required 13+ months ago (with ongoing inhaler/nebulizer treatment) → Standard. No oxygen or ongoing inhaler/nebulizer treatment → Preferred.
Diagnosed ≥20 years ago → Preferred. Insulin use prior to age 50 → Standard. Currently controlled with insulin use → Preferred.

Insulin shock/diabetic coma in last 24 months → Modified. Insulin shock/diabetic coma ≥25 months ago → Preferred. Retinopathy in last 24 months → Modified. Retinopathy ≥25 months ago → Preferred. Nephropathy or Neuropathy in last 24 months → Modified. Nephropathy/Neuropathy ≥25 months ago → Preferred. Amputation due to diabetes → Decline.
Any history of defibrillator placement → Decline.
Any medically diagnosed dementia → Decline.
Recommended within past 0–12 months (no results) → Decline. Recommended within past 13–24 months (no results) → Standard. Recommended ≥25 months ago (no results) → Standard.
Diagnosed/treated 0–24 months ago → Standard. Diagnosed/treated 24–36 months ago → Standard. Diagnosed/treated ≥37 months ago → Standard.
Heart attack within past 0–12 months → Modified. 13–24 months ago → Standard. 25–36 months ago → Preferred.
Ever medically diagnosed but not surgically repaired → Decline.
Surgery within past 0–12 months → Modified. 13–24 months ago → Standard. 25–36 months ago → Preferred.
Diagnosed/treated 0–24 months ago → Modified. 24–36 months ago → Preferred. ≥37 months ago → Preferred.
Diagnosed/treated 0–24 months ago → Modified. 24–36 months ago → Preferred. ≥37 months ago → Preferred.
Currently receiving → Decline. Not currently receiving or advised to receive → Preferred.
Currently receiving hospice care → Decline.
Currently hospitalized or confined → Decline. Not currently hospitalized/advised → Preferred.
Any medically treated or diagnosed Huntington's → Decline.
Any history of dialysis or advised to have → Decline.
Diagnosed/treated 0–24 months ago → Modified. Diagnosed/treated ≥25 months ago → Preferred.
Treated other than dialysis in last 24 months → Modified. Treated for dialysis in last 12 months → Decline.
Diagnosed/treated 0–24 months ago → Modified. 24–36 months ago → Preferred.
Any history of liver failure → Decline.
Any history of lupus → Standard.
Any history of mental incapacity → Decline.
Any history of multiple sclerosis → Standard.
Any history of muscular dystrophy → Decline.
Hospitalized for a nervous disorder within past 24 months → Standard.
No nicotine or tobacco within 12 months → Non-Smoker (Preferred). Any other tobacco/nicotine use (including cigarettes, cigars, pipe) within 12 months → Smoker (Standard/Modified).
Any history of organ transplant → Decline.
Used oxygen within last 12 months (even if not currently) → Decline. Used oxygen 13–24 months ago → Standard.
Inserted 0–12 months ago → Modified. 13–24 months ago → Standard. 25–36 months ago → Modified. ≥37 months ago → Modified or Preferred (table shows X in Preferred for ≥37 months).
If no help needed with ADLs despite paralysis → Preferred. Otherwise, decline language not shown explicitly.
Any history of Parkinson's → Standard.
Any history of schizophrenia → Standard.
Medically diagnosed/treated within 3 years → Standard.
Treated 0–12 months ago → Modified. 13–24 months ago → Standard. 25–36 months ago → Preferred. ≥37 months ago → Preferred.
Any medically diagnosed or treated terminal illness (life expectancy ≤12 months) → Decline.
Diagnosed/treated within past 3 years → Standard.
Current wheelchair use not due to disease → Standard. Current wheelchair use due to disease (not accident) → Decline.

laboratory_requirements.description: No laboratory, blood, or paramedical exam requirements are specified—this guide assumes a fully simplified issue final expense model based solely on disease history.

risk_classes.description: Rate classifications are exactly the four columns shown: Preferred, Standard, Modified, and Decline.  Each condition/time-frame combination maps to one or more of these four risk classes.

classes.name: Preferred
criteria: No disqualifying medical conditions in the past specified time-frames (e.g., no active cancer within 24 months, no oxygen use in past 13 months, etc.)
No ongoing ADL dependency
No recent heart surgery (past 25+ months acceptable)
No insulin-dependent diabetes with complications in last 24 months
No current wheelchair use due to disease

classes.name: Standard
criteria: Certain conditions treated at least 13–24 months ago (e.g., aneurysm, COPD, cardiac catheterization)
No terminal or end-stage disease within last 12 months
Controlled diabetes diagnosed ≥20 years ago or currently controlled with insulin
No oxygen use in past 13–24 months
No active substance abuse in past 2 years

classes.name: Modified
criteria: Condition treated within past 0–12 or 0–24 months (e.g., cardiac surgery, COPD, hepatitis, diabetic complications)
Active but non-terminal conditions (e.g., pneumonia, cirrhosis, chronic pancreatitis) treated within past 24 months
Pacemaker inserted 0–12 or 25–36 months ago
Any diagnostic testing/surgery/hospitalization recommended in past 0–24 months with no follow-up results

classes.name: Decline
criteria: Terminal illness (life expectancy ≤12 months)
ALS, Alzheimer's, dementia, or Huntington's disease at any time
Active oxygen use within past 12 months
AIDS/HIV at any time
Recent heart attack (within 0–12 months) or CHF at any time
Any dialysis, kidney transplant, or end-stage renal disease

tobacco_guidelines.description: Nicotine use (cigarettes, pipes, cigars, chewing tobacco, vaping) within the past 12 months classifies the applicant as a Smoker (Standard/Modified). Occasional cigar/pipe use (≤12/year) or nicotine substitutes do not automatically decline but follow the same smoker classification. No nicotine/tobacco in past 12 months qualifies for Non-Smoker (Preferred).

classifications.classification: No nicotine or tobacco use in the past 12 months; occasional cigar/pipe use (≤12/year) allowed if negative cotinine.
Any nicotine or tobacco use in past 12 months (including cigarettes, cigars, pipe, chewing tobacco, vaping).

financial_underwriting.description: Not addressed in this guide.  Coverage is final expense—face amounts are small enough that no income verification or financial multiples are required.

special_considerations.description: Beyond disease criteria, there are no additional factors (e.g., occupation, travel) specified in this guide.  Eligibility is determined solely by the conditions table above.
